channel.title: Pytorch on tomato blog
channel.description: Recent content in Pytorch on tomato blog

item.title: Eliminate dtype in numpy to pytorch conversion
item.description: x = np.random.rand(5) print(x) torch_x = torch.tensor(x) print(torch_x) [0.07875406 0.96178392 0.64953209 0.12122955 0.92958997] tensor([0.0788, 0.9618, 0.6495, 0.1212, 0.9296], dtype=torch.float64) If the numpy array is converted directly to torch, the dtype remains. torch_x = torch.tensor(x.astype(np.float32)) print(torch_x) tensor([0.0788, 0.9618, 0.6495, 0.1212, 0.9296]) To get rid of the dtype, we need to convert the numpy type to float32 and then to torch.
